result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J. Derus #00481323 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with victim, B.M.K. (dob: 8/26/97). 

Maintain absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol. 

No contact with anyone under the age of 18 years old without prior agent approval and an approved chaperone.

Remain in compliance with sex offender registry program. 

Complete any assessment, treatment, counseling deemed necessary by agent.  

Provide DNA sample.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 2:35pm
State appears by DA Theresa Wetzsteon; Deft appears by telephone from Redgranite Correctional Institution and his Atty Britteny LaFond appears in person. 
Date and time set for defendant's motion for post conviction motion and state's objection response

Atty LaFond makes argument based on post conviction motion filed regarding: 1) order granting withdrawal of plea because the plea was not entered in knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently made manner because deft did not hold the proper mindset to comprehend, or rather enter his plea, based on deft's detox symptoms and lack of his prescription medication; 2) Order granting withdrawal of the plea because the defendant was deprived of his right to effective assistance of counsel because Atty Zoesch failed to conduct any investigations, failed to communicate with deft, failed to review discovery with deft, failed to provide discovery to deft, and failed to discuss various motions that could have or should have been filed with deft. 
State objects and makes argument to deny the defenses post conviction motions until defense can provide substantial contradictory evidence for the motion
COURT ORDERS: Grants state's motion to have defense file supplemental motions and attachments to fully support the inadequacy of plea colloquy & ineffective counsel within 30 days and then State responding to supplemental motions within 30 days after that
COURT will have counsel set aside 2-3 hours with court in 90 days
Adj: 2:45pm
IT IS ORDERED that the time for deciding the postconviction motion is extended to May 9, 2018

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 8:34am
State appears by DA Theresa Wetzsteon; Defendant appears in person with Atty Gabriel Siehr.
Date and time set for sentencing hearing

Parties have received PSI; no corrections need to be made
State would like to clarify on initial confinement cap to sentencing would be 5 years IC; Atty Siehr has disagreement with initial confinement amount being less
COURT will have court reporter prepare page of transcript from 3/22/16 plea hearing to clarify the amount State would be capping initial confinement at
OTR: 8:40am
BOTR: 8:54am
COURT has been provided with copy of page 6 of 3/22/16 plea hearing transcript that has State capping initial confinement at 5 years
Parties proceed with arguments
State makes sentencing argument
Atty Siehr makes sentencing argument
Defendant makes statement
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: Ct. 1 (3rd degree sexual assault-repeater): 7 years WSPS- 3 years IC, 4 years ES. 134 days credit for jail time already served. Deft is NOT eligible for either prison programming- Substance Abuse or Challenge Incarceration. CONDITIONS of ES: No contact with victim- B.M.K. (DOB 8/26/97). Remain in compliance with sex offender registry program. Maintain absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol. No contact with anyone under age of 18 years old with out prior agent approval and an approved chaperone. Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Pay all court ordered obligations, restitution, supervision fees, and any other fees or fines. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 

Parties to maintain PSI reports in confidental manner. 
VRCW by state.
Defendant is remanded to Marathon County Sheriff's Dept to be transported to Prison.

Case Called: 11:05am
State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon; Deft appears in person with Atty Thomas Zoesch. Defendant's mother appears - Susan Menott
Date and time set for motion to modify bond filed by defense

Atty Zoesch says deft mother posted $5000 cash bond and mother wishes to have money back
Atty Zoesch wishes to have bond changed to signature bond or portion of cash bond returned to mother
State does have concerns of stability of deft residence and previous criminal history
State does not want signature bond, but if court wishes to change bond, state is not against mother co-signing
State reiterates bond conditions to mother if she wishes to co-sign
COURT grants defense request to modify bond to co-sign
COURT ORDERS: $5000 signature bond and first $1000 in cash and remaining balance to be co-signed by defendant's mother and defendant
COURT absolute sobriety, no contact with victim B.M.K. and no contact with females under age 18
States wishes to have court add bond condition of having deft new address with grandmother
Defendant has new address with grandmother: 710 Desnoyer St. Kaukauna, WI 54130
COURT adds bond condition of residing with grandmother as residential stability - Joan Jaeckes
